skill.name: obsidian-bases
skill.description: Create and edit Obsidian Bases (.base files) with views, filters, formulas, and summaries. Use when working with .base files, creating database-like views of notes, or when the user mentions Bases, table views, card views, filters, or formulas in Obsidian.
skill.summary: Create and edit Obsidian Bases (.base files) with views, filters, formulas, and summaries. Use when ...
skill.author: kepano

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only instructional content for creating Obsidian Bases YAML files. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Obsidian Bases lets you create database-like views of your notes with tables, cards, lists, and maps. This skill provides complete documentation for writing valid .base YAML files with filters, formulas, and summaries.
actual_capabilities: Create valid Obsidian Bases YAML files with .base extension
Define multiple view types: table, cards, list, and map
Configure global and view-specific filters with and/or/not logic
Write formula properties for computed values
Set up custom summary formulas for data aggregation
Configure property display names and ordering
limitations: Only generates YAML content for .base files, does not read or modify existing files
Does not interact with Obsidian application or vault
Does not execute formulas or validate data at runtime
Requires Obsidian Bases plugin to render views

use_cases.title: Build task tracking systems
use_cases.description: Create task databases with status, priority, due dates, and automated priority labels.

use_cases.title: Organize reading collections
use_cases.description: Build library databases with book metadata, reading status, and progress tracking.

use_cases.title: Monitor project notes
use_cases.description: Track project documentation with update times, link counts, and status groupings.

prompt_templates.title: Basic table view
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an Obsidian Base called Tasks.base that shows all notes tagged with task in a table view with columns for name, status, priority, and due date.

prompt_templates.title: Cards with filters
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Reading List.base file with a cards view showing book covers, titles, authors, and reading status icons. Filter out dropped books.

prompt_templates.title: Formulas and summaries
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Projects.base with a formula that calculates days until due date and shows overdue items in red. Add average priority summary.

prompt_templates.title: Complex nested filters
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Research.base that shows notes in the Projects folder that are either tagged important and not done, or have priority 1 and a due date. Group by status.

output_examples.input: Create a task tracker Base with active and completed views
output: Task Tracker.base file with table views
Active Tasks view: shows incomplete tasks grouped by status
Completed view: shows done tasks ordered by completion date
Formula for days until due with overdue highlighting

best_practices: Use single quotes around formulas containing double quotes to avoid YAML parsing errors
Group related views together and use consistent naming conventions for properties
Test filters with simple conditions before building complex nested logic
anti_patterns: Avoid embedding executable code or script references in formula expressions
Do not use the same display name for multiple properties in a single view
Avoid circular formula references that create infinite dependency loops

faq.question: What Obsidian versions support Bases?
faq.answer: Bases requires Obsidian 1.4+ and the Bases plugin installed from the community plugins.

faq.question: How many views can a Base contain?
faq.answer: A single Base file can contain an unlimited number of views of different types.

faq.question: Can Bases connect to external data?
faq.answer: Bases reads only from your Obsidian vault. External data must be imported as notes first.

faq.question: Is my data safe with Bases?
faq.answer: Yes. Bases only reads your vault data locally. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why are my formulas not showing results?
faq.answer: Check that referenced properties exist on your notes. Formulas require numeric values for math operations.

faq.question: How is Bases different from Dataview?
faq.answer: Bases creates persistent .base YAML files that define reusable views. Dataview uses inline queries.
